module_summaries.summary:
Users can log in using their credentials.
Displays login form and error messages if authentication fails.

Users can retrieve forgotten login information.
Displays prompts for missing fields and error messages if no match is found.

Users can register a new account.
Displays registration form and confirmation upon successful account creation.

Users can open a new savings or checking account.
Displays form for account type selection and funding source.

Users can view all their account details.
Displays account numbers, balances, and available amounts.

Users can transfer funds between accounts.
Displays form for amount and account selection for transfer.

Users can make bill payments to various payees.
Displays form for payee details and payment confirmation message.

Users can search for specific transactions.
Displays search results based on transaction ID, date, or amount.

Users can update their profile information.
Displays form for personal details and confirmation upon update.

Users can apply for a loan using their account.
Displays loan application form and approval status.

Users can securely log out of their account.
Displays no data and redirects to the login page.

test_cases.title: Successful login with username
test_cases.expected_result: User is taken to their account dashboard

test_cases.title: Successful login with email
test_cases.expected_result: User is taken to their account dashboard

test_cases.title: Login form elements displayed correctly
steps: Verify the presence of the username or email field
Verify the presence of the password field
Verify the presence of the Log In button
Verify the presence of the Forgot login info? link
Verify the presence of the Register link
test_cases.expected_result: All login form elements are displayed correctly

test_cases.title: Successful recovery with all valid details
test_cases.workflow: Find login information with customer details
steps: Click on the Find My Login Info button
test_cases.expected_result: Recovery details displayed

test_cases.title: Successful registration with all valid inputs
steps: Enter the same password in Confirm Password
test_cases.expected_result: Account is created and user is logged in

test_cases.title: Open new checking account with valid funding source
test_cases.preconditions: User is authenticated and on the Open New Account page
steps: Select a valid funding source with sufficient balance
test_cases.expected_result: New checking account is created, $100.00 is deducted from the funding source, and a unique account number is generated

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the new checking account is created with a unique account number
post_verifications.matched_test_title: Verify account number is displayed in the Accounts Overview
post_verifications.execution_note: Run this test after creating a new checking account to verify the account number is displayed.
post_verifications.reason: The test verifies the presence of an account number but does not check for uniqueness.
post_verifications.suggested_manual_step: Manually verify that the new account number is unique by comparing it with existing account numbers.

post_verifications.ideal: Verify $100.00 is deducted from the funding source
post_verifications.reason: None of the test cases verify the deduction of $100.00 from the funding source balance. They only verify the presence of balance or account information, not the change in balance.
post_verifications.suggested_manual_step: Manually check the account overview page after the transaction to ensure the funding source balance is reduced by $100.00.

coverage_gaps: The test verifies the presence of an account number but does not check for uniqueness.
None of the test cases verify the deduction of $100.00 from the funding source balance. They only verify the presence of balance or account information, not the change in balance.

test_cases.title: Open new savings account with valid funding source
test_cases.preconditions: User is authenticated and on the Open New Account page
steps: Select a valid funding source with sufficient balance
test_cases.expected_result: New savings account is created, $100.00 is deducted from the funding source, and a unique account number is generated

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the new savings account is created with a unique account number
post_verifications.matched_test_title: Verify account number is displayed in the Accounts Overview
post_verifications.execution_note: Run this test after creating a new savings account to verify the account number is displayed in the Accounts Overview.
post_verifications.reason: The test case verifies that an account number is displayed, but does not specifically check for uniqueness or that a new account is listed.
post_verifications.suggested_manual_step: Manually verify that the account number is unique and that the new savings account is listed in the Accounts Overview.

post_verifications.ideal: Verify $100.00 is deducted from the funding source
post_verifications.reason: None of the test cases verify the deduction of $100.00 from the funding source. They all focus on displaying information without checking for specific balance changes.
post_verifications.suggested_manual_step: Manually check the funding source balance before and after the transaction to ensure $100.00 is deducted.

coverage_gaps: The test case verifies that an account number is displayed, but does not specifically check for uniqueness or that a new account is listed.
None of the test cases verify the deduction of $100.00 from the funding source. They all focus on displaying information without checking for specific balance changes.

test_cases.title: Verify new account is visible in account overview after creation
test_cases.preconditions: User has successfully opened a new account
steps: Navigate to the account overview page
Verify the new account is listed with the correct account type and balance
test_cases.expected_result: New account is visible in the account overview with the correct details

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the new account is visible in the account overview with correct details
post_verifications.matched_test_title: Verify balance is displayed in the Accounts Overview
post_verifications.execution_note: Run this test after creating a new account to verify the balance is displayed, but it does not verify account type.
post_verifications.reason: The test case checks for balance display in the Account Overview, which is part of the requirement, but it does not verify the account type.
post_verifications.suggested_manual_step: Manually check the account type in the Account Overview after running this test.

coverage_gaps: The test case checks for balance display in the Account Overview, which is part of the requirement, but it does not verify the account type.

test_cases.title: Successful fund transfer between accounts
test_cases.preconditions: User is logged in and on the Transfer Funds page
test_cases.expected_result: Transaction is processed successfully

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the transaction is recorded successfully
post_verifications.matched_test_title: Find transactions with all valid inputs
post_verifications.execution_note: Run this test after the transaction is expected to be recorded to verify it appears in the search results.

test_cases.title: Verify account balance update after transfer
test_cases.preconditions: User is logged in and on the Transfer Funds page
steps: Verify the balance of the 'From account' is reduced by the transfer amount
Verify the balance of the 'To account' is increased by the transfer amount
test_cases.expected_result: Balances are updated correctly after the transfer

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the balance of the 'From account' is reduced by the transfer amount
post_verifications.reason: None of the test cases verify the reduction of the 'From account' balance by the transfer amount. They only check for the presence of balance or available amount, not the specific change after a transfer.
post_verifications.suggested_manual_step: After performing a transfer, manually check the 'From account' balance on the Account Overview page to ensure it has decreased by the transfer amount.

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the balance of the 'To account' is increased by the transfer amount
post_verifications.reason: None of the test cases verify the increase in balance of the 'To account' after a transfer. They only check for the display of balances, not changes due to transactions.
post_verifications.suggested_manual_step: After performing a transfer, manually check the 'To account' balance on the Account Overview page to ensure it has increased by the transfer amount.

coverage_gaps: None of the test cases verify the reduction of the 'From account' balance by the transfer amount. They only check for the presence of balance or available amount, not the specific change after a transfer.
None of the test cases verify the increase in balance of the 'To account' after a transfer. They only check for the display of balances, not changes due to transactions.

post_verifications.reason: All candidate test cases focus on error messages for empty fields and do not check for a payment confirmation message after a successful transaction.

coverage_gaps: All candidate test cases focus on error messages for empty fields and do not check for a payment confirmation message after a successful transaction.
